intro: Casearia oreogenes, commonly known as the mountain casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mountainous areas. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
